alert.note: Alert for Mohave (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 22 at 4:45PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...East central Mohave County in northwestern Arizona near Peach Springs. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 441 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Radar estimates that 1.0 to 1.5 inches of rain has fallen over the warned area. Additional rainfall is possible over the next few hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Diamond Creek Campground, Diamond Creek Road, Peach Springs Wash, Box Canyon, Mesquite Springs Campground, and Peach Springs. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
